instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 short beeps... RAM?
threads.message: I have another 2915 that gives 3 short beeps continuously when its powered on. This happens with any RAM in any slot. 1 stick or  both. When I remove the RAM and power it up it gives normal "No RAM installed" beep. Thanks, have a good day.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 short beeps... RAM?
threads.message: 1.5V present on L7330? If yes then in the trash it goes.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 short beeps... RAM?
threads.message: 1.5V is Present. I know you said trash, but what is it? Dead CPU? Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 short beeps... RAM?
threads.message: CPU, RAM slots, traces, all not fixable really. You could check the slots with a RAM slot tester card. I don't bother with the 3 beep boards, even if you fix it it will be back next month claiming warranty on a dead GPU, avoid.
